intro: Jasminum fluminense var. blandum, commonly known as the Brazilian jasmine or sweet senna, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, characterized by its fragrant white flowers. The plant features opposite, simple, and lance-shaped leaves, often with a glossy surface. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, emitting a sweet scent. The botanical structure of this species is well adapted to its humid, warm climate, supporting its growth in moist, well-drained soils.
